alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 14 at 7:43PM CST until December 17 at 1:42AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Sumter and Pickens Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the basin is expected to produce minor flooding on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Thursday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 115.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 122.8 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
